definition: to transcribe/to make a fair copy

sentences.english: Should there is a long letter which has some trivial mistakes be rewritten again?
sentences.chinese: 一封長信有幾個微不足道的錯誤就得重謄一遍嗎？

sentences.english: Won a good social transcript of the letter, received by the owners of all walks of life and well received.
sentences.chinese: 贏得了良好的社會信謄，深受業主和各界的好評。

sentences.english: I again can not endure so ardent weather.
sentences.chinese: 我再也不能忍謄如此熱的天氣了。

sentences.english: The ink from my pen blotted my letter, and I had to copy it over.
sentences.chinese: 鋼筆的墨水玷污了我的信，我必須重謄一次。

sentences.english: On my honor, I pledge allegiance to this organization.
sentences.chinese: 以我的名謄，我發誓對這組織效忠。

definition: to transcribe/to make a fair copy
variant character/loan word/variant written form (for the same word)/different edition
to copy (a text) from person to person/(of a text) to be transmitted by copying
belly/skin/to state/to pass on information/to display
the four book depositories, namely: classics 經|经, history 史, philosophy 子[zi3], belles-lettres 集
